meanings: (요구) insisting, pressing, urging, (격려) spurring, (조르다) 촉구하다 urge, press, (요구하다) demand, call upon (a person to do)
(재촉하다) press (sb to do), urge (sb to do), (요구하다) demand, (공식적으로) call (up)on (sb to do)

examples.korean: They had been exhorted to action. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그들은 행동을 (취하도록) 촉구받았었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: They had been exhorted to action. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Both sides were urged to lay down their arms. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 양측 모두에게 무기를 내려놓으라[버리라]는 촉구가 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Both sides were urged to lay down their arms. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: These riots should be a wake-up call for the government. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 이들 폭동은 정부의 주의를 촉구하는 사건이 될 것이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: These riots should be a wake-up call for the government. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: I urge the house to vote against the motion. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 저는 이 토의에 모인 여러분들께 그 발의에 반대표를 던지시기를 촉구하는 바입니다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: I urge the house to vote against the motion. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: We urged them to sort out the problem sooner rather than later. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 우리는 그들에게 차라리 일찌감치 그 문제를 해결하라고 촉구했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: We urged them to sort out the problem sooner rather than later. Add to Wordbook
